main event: A blue blinking light, size of a star, was observed over Thule AFB, Greenland on 31 September 1958.
interesting points: The object disappeared for about 10 to 15 seconds and then reappeared., The estimated speed of the object was around 1500 to 1800 knots., The observation lasted for approximately 2 minutes., The sight was evaluated as an unreliable report due to insufficient data for evaluation., The possible explanations included that it could have been a balloon or a satellite.
witness description: George E Jolly, Capt. USAF; Ernest H. Walthall, Capt. USAF; Edward E. Warthling, 1/LT USAF
